bibl.title: The Graeco-Roman Elements in the Temples of Upper Egypt.
bibl.note: New elements, well known in Greek and Roman architecture, appeared in the temples of Upper Egypt during the Ptolemaic and Roman period. Architects of these temples, if not Greeks or Romans, may have been Egyptians trained or acquainted with Greek and Roman architecture.

bibl.title: Alessandria e il mondo ellenistico-romano. I Centenario del Museo Greco-Romano. Alessandria, 23-27 Novembre 1992. Atti del II Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano

bibl.seg: EL FAKHARANI Fawzi, The Graeco-Roman Elements in the Temples of Upper Egypt.

Alessandria e il mondo ellenistico-romano. I Centenario del Museo Greco-Romano. Alessandria, 23-27 Novembre 1992. Atti del II Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano (Roma, 1995) pp. 151-155, 4 plans et pl. 15.

New elements, well known in Greek and Roman architecture, appeared in the temples of Upper Egypt during the Ptolemaic and Roman period. Architects of these temples, if not Greeks or Romans, may have been Egyptians trained or acquainted with Greek and Roman architecture.
